events.name: Ni Supply System Dynamics
events.wd_description: The Ni supply system's dynamics are influenced by various subsystems and stakeholders. The separation of these systems helps in understanding how developments in one subsystem can cause bottlenecks in another.
events.description: The Ni supply system's dynamics are influenced by various subsystems and stakeholders. The separation of these systems helps in understanding how developments in one subsystem can cause bottlenecks in another.

events.name: Vehicle Manufacturers
events.wd_description: Vehicle manufacturers and users control battery chemistries and EV production/penetration but have less influence over elements of the Ni supply system.
events.description: Vehicle manufacturers and users control battery chemistries and EV production/penetration but have less influence over elements of the Ni supply system.

events.name: Mining Companies
events.wd_description: Mining companies control facilities spanning several processes of the Ni supply subsystem but have less influence over the LiB demand subsystem.
events.description: Mining companies control facilities spanning several processes of the Ni supply subsystem but have less influence over the LiB demand subsystem.

events.name: Policy Measures
events.wd_description: Policy measures target specific subsystems but can influence other subsystems indirectly.
events.description: Policy measures target specific subsystems but can influence other subsystems indirectly.

events.name: Agreements Between Stakeholders
events.wd_description: Agreements between stakeholders in various subsystems influence the overall dynamics of the Ni supply system.
events.description: Agreements between stakeholders in various subsystems influence the overall dynamics of the Ni supply system.

events.name: Non-Battery Demand Subsystem
events.wd_description: The non-battery demand subsystem models all demand for Ni products that are not specifically LiBs and provides market competition to the LiB sector for Ni resources.
events.description: The non-battery demand subsystem models all demand for Ni products that are not specifically LiBs and provides market competition to the LiB sector for Ni resources.

events.name: Non-Battery Demand
events.wd_description: The subsystem models all demand for Ni products that are not specifically LiBs.
events.description: The subsystem models all demand for Ni products that are not specifically LiBs.

events.name: Stainless Steel Industry
events.wd_description: Stainless steel feedstocks can be flexible, using either class 1 or class 2, but some amount of class 1 is necessary to adjust purity levels.
events.description: Stainless steel feedstocks can be flexible, using either class 1 or class 2, but some amount of class 1 is necessary to adjust purity levels.

events.name: Historical Driver
events.wd_description: The non-battery demand subsystem has historically driven the Ni supply chain.
events.description: The non-battery demand subsystem has historically driven the Ni supply chain.

events.name: Feedstock Differentiation and Demand
events.wd_description: The need for feedstock differentiation is maintained in the model structure by dividing inflow into total demand and minimum demand parameters for class 1 and sulphate.
events.description: The need for feedstock differentiation is maintained in the model structure by dividing inflow into total demand and minimum demand parameters for class 1 and sulphate.

events.name: Class 1 Nickel
events.wd_description: Class 1 nickel is necessary for certain processes and is included in the model as a minimum demand parameter.
events.description: Class 1 nickel is necessary for certain processes and is included in the model as a minimum demand parameter.

events.name: Sulphate
events.wd_description: Sulphate is another important feedstock included as a minimum demand parameter in the model.
events.description: Sulphate is another important feedstock included as a minimum demand parameter in the model.

events.name: Process Inflows
events.wd_description: The inflow to processes is divided into total demand and minimum demand parameters.
events.description: The inflow to processes is divided into total demand and minimum demand parameters.

events.name: Model Run Storylines
events.wd_description: Four parameter set storylines for the NoB Demand Subsystem are taken from publicly available projections for Ni demand.
events.description: Four parameter set storylines for the NoB Demand Subsystem are taken from publicly available projections for Ni demand.

events.name: Baseline Values and Vertical Integration
events.wd_description: Baseline values are assigned for established supply chains that persist despite changes in the macro supply environment. Vertical integration of facilities along the supply chain is important for securing supply.
events.description: Baseline values are assigned for established supply chains that persist despite changes in the macro supply environment. Vertical integration of facilities along the supply chain is important for securing supply.

events.name: Baseline Values
events.wd_description: Baseline values are assigned in situations where a supply chain is established and will likely persist despite changes in the macro supply environment.
events.description: Baseline values are assigned in situations where a supply chain is established and will likely persist despite changes in the macro supply environment.

events.name: Vertical Integration
events.wd_description: Vertical integration of facilities along the supply chain from mining to production is important for securing supply.
events.description: Vertical integration of facilities along the supply chain from mining to production is important for securing supply.

events.name: Metal Refineries
events.wd_description: Certain metal refineries are technologically adapted to particular feedstocks and have supply relationships that are inflexible to market forces.
events.description: Certain metal refineries are technologically adapted to particular feedstocks and have supply relationships that are inflexible to market forces.

events.name: Automotive Sector
events.wd_description: The automotive sector increasingly aims at securing their supply of batteries and associated materials through vertical integration.
events.description: The automotive sector increasingly aims at securing their supply of batteries and associated materials through vertical integration.

events.name: Influence of stakeholders
events.description: The parameters of different systems are largely controlled by stakeholders, such as vehicle manufacturers and users, who control battery chemistries and EV production, and mining companies, who control facilities spanning several processes of the Ni supply subsystem.

events.name: Policy measures targeting subsystems
events.description: Policy measures may target specific subsystems, but agreements between stakeholders and policies can impact other parts of the system, such as the EU directive limiting embodied carbon in batteries sold in Europe.

events.name: Market competition with LiB sector
events.description: The non-battery demand subsystem provides market competition to the LiB sector for Ni resources and has historically driven the Ni supply chain.

events.name: Class 1 loading rate
events.description: Stainless steel feedstocks require some amount of class 1 nickel to adjust purity levels, which is relevant to the availability of nickel for LiB production.

events.name: Minimum demand parameters
events.description: The model structure includes minimum demand parameters for class 1 nickel and sulphate, describing the minimum flows necessary for certain processes.

events.name: Publicly available projections
events.description: The model run includes parameter set storylines based on publicly available projections for future Ni demand from consulting firms like Roskill and Wood MacKenzie.

events.name: Technological adaptation of refineries
events.description: Metal refineries are often technologically adapted to specific feedstocks, making them less responsive to market forces and leading to vertically integrated facilities.

events.name: Securing supply in the automotive sector
events.description: The automotive sector increasingly aims at securing its supply of batteries and associated materials through vertical integration along the supply chain from mining to production.
